title: Pick-A-Box: Episode 401
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Quiz shows
abstract: Quiz show hosted by Bob Dyer and his wife Dolly which ran from 1957 to 1971 and was based on the 1948 radio program of the same name.
description: Contestants are wearing sound-proof headphones so that they can’t hear each other’s answers and are asked the same questions. The person with the correct answer then gets to 'pick a box’ to win a prize, which could be anything from elastic bands to a new car. The compere Bob, takes the chosen box, looks at the prize written inside and then without revealing it to the contestant, offers a sum of money in place of the prize. The contestant must then decide whether to keep the prize and leave, or play a new opponent for the chance to add to their prize haul but also risk losing it. Barry Jones who became the undefeated champion went on to become a State and Federal Member of Parliament. Screened on the Seven Network. Source:  Australian Screen
